The correct answer is C: [00:07:56 - 00:08:58]. 

In the provided excerpt, the narrator mentions that the price elasticity of demand for electricity is a complex topic and will be discussed later on in the video. The narrator then goes on to describe how an electric company might raise its rates if it wants to generate more revenue. This is followed by an overlay of text that reads "11% RATE INCREASE!" and an image of an airplane and newspaper, suggesting that the contrast between the electric company raising prices and an airline lowering prices could be used as an example of the difference in price elasticity between different industries. Therefore, the relevant time segment for this excerpt is from 00:07:56 to 00:08:58.

The correct answer is A: [00:07:25 - 00:07:55]. 

In this segment of the audio, there is a real-life utility pole photo with the text "ELECTRIC CO. Rate Increase of 15% Approved!" on it. This is followed by a light bulb and graphs showing a slight consumption decrease but rising revenues. The narrator then explains that electricity demand is inelastic and that raising prices increases total revenue.
